title: Ather files for IPO, to raise Rs 3,100 crore in fresh capital
description: Founded in 2013 on the IIT Madras campus, Ather Energy – winner of The Economic Times Startup Awards in the Best on Campus category in 2016 – competes with the likes of Ola Electric Mobility that went public last month.
content: Ather Energy has filed draft papers for its initial public offering, through which the electric two-wheeler maker plans to raise Rs 3,100 crore in fresh capital and conduct an offer for sale (OFS) of 22 million shares held by existing investors.Shareholders including founders Tarun Mehta and Swapnil Jain, Tiger Global, GIC, National Investment and Infrastructure Fund (NIIF), Flipkart cofounder Binny Bansal’s Three State Ventures and IIT Madras Incubation Cell will sell part of their stake via the IPO, the Bengaluru-based company said in the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) filed with markets regulator Sebi on Monday.India’s largest two-wheeler maker Hero MotoCorp, the biggest shareholder and promoter of Ather Energy with over 37% stake, will not sell any shares through the IPO.Founded in 2013 on the IIT Madras campus, Ather Energy – winner of The Economic Times Startup Awards in the Best on Campus category in 2016 – competes with the likes of Ola Electric Mobility that went public last month.Ather Energy plans to utilise proceeds from the IPO for capital expenditure to establish an electric two-wheeler factory in Maharashtra and for research and development, as per the DRHP.
